heisigComment: * This kanji, which appears often as a primitive, can mean saying, speech, or words, depending on which is most useful.
heisigStory: Of all the things we can do with our mouths, speech is the one that requires the greatest distinctness and clarity. Hence the kanji for say has four little sound-waves, indicating the complexity of the achievement.
koohiiStory1: A pictogram of someone saying a four letter word from their mouth after the censors have gotten a hold of it.
koohiiStory2: This is simple a pictogram of a mouth SAYing something. The lines are soundwaves. No need to complicate it.
myStory: nói. hai người đội mũ mở miệng nói
